_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Frozen Fruit, Juice, and Vegetable Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Clement-Pappas' Mountain Home Plant is a major
producer of fruit juice and juice concentrates.  Products are
derived from either bulk juice concentrates or fresh fruit.
Anhydrous ammonia is used in the plant refrigeration system and,
since inventory exceeds 15,000 pounds, PSM Regulations are
applicable to this facility.

Operations present a risk to both onsite (employees) and offsite
receptors (the public).  It is the Company's policy to minimize
negative impact upon both groups by maintaining a constant vigil
on its operations, with planning and prevention being essential
components of its efforts.

The employee's appreciation of the dangers associated with
anhydrous ammonia begins during New Employee Orientation and
continues throughout the term of employment.  Empolyees are major
stakeholders in safe operations and are actively involved in
developing and implementing the PSM Program.  Periodic, timely
training emphasizing concepts needed to ensure personal safety and
proper reaction to emergency situations further demonstrates the
Company's commitment to safe operations.  In-plant monitoring of
key areas provides a safe work environment along with adequate
warning of any threat to employees' safety; changes in operation
require evaluation of relevant safety issues.

The public is well served through the Company's close involvement
with local emergency response organizations.  Plant management
works with incident response personnel as needed.  Public
notification procedures have been developed.

The Off-Site Consequence Analysis (OCA) has been completed for
present operating conditions for plant personnel information only.

Employee awareness might be the single most important factor in
minimizing accidental releases to the atmosphere, and the Company
strives to keep awareness levels at the highest by mandating
periodic employee training.  Staff are actively involved with
programs designed to protect the work environment - the PSM
Program, for example, provides a

framework for working with
hazardous materials.  The Safety Committee has a long history of
active involvement on behalf of the employees and the employer.
Equipment designs employ "Best Engineering Practices" and
conservative safety factors.  Safe work practices are formalized,
and change is evaluated for its impact on safety.

The Company is a willing partner with local emergency response
agencies and other governmental offices, providing the system to
protect public health in the event of a release.

Has the effort been a success?  There has not been a notable
accidental release of ammonia during the past fifteen years.
Still, plans to constantly review and improve performance are in
place.  A recent audit of the PSM Program identified several ways
in which our operations could be improved, and the Company reacted
positively to those suggestions.  Standard operating procedures
are reviewed periodically.  Management of Change analyses precede
installation of new equipment.  Opportunities for enhancing staff
capability will continue to be made available.

Clement-Pappas" Mouontain Home Plant is committed to maintaining
its status as a welcomed member of this community.
